reviews.review_msg: Reads word-for-word off of power points, extremely unclear explanations when it comes to end of chapter problems, and asks the class to participate in extremely ambiguous and irrelevant questions but will then display a negative attitude/response when valid questions are raised by students.

One practice questions per lecture that you have to be in class to write down the answers. These are the only questions given to you to practice for the midterm and the final, but it doesn't matter because the exam questions are way more convoluted. textbook offers no practice questions and strictly for theory. Lectures are boring.

Johnny really provides little value as you can mainly learn everything from the textbook, but you will still have to attend lectures for the mathematical questions worth a third of both the final and midterm exams. He provides little to no grades going into the final and the cases can be brutal due to participation he attaches to them.

He is a very friendly proff. The only thing that I did not like about Johnny was that you never knew how you were doing in his class until the very end. He never released any marks and when you asked him, he would say "see me at the end of the semester." I found that he subjectively curves the grades based on qualitative information. Beware!

Super approachable and friendly guy. However, content covered in class is tested in a way more complex manner in exams. Exam questions are rather confusing and too long. No practice problems given so hard to judge what type of exam Q's there will be because they are harder than content covered in class.

He is a nice guy, but can be  narrow minded. He punishes creative solutions. He will take time to listen to your argument, however, its pretty much impossible to change his mind. Overall class aint too hard though.

He might be one of the worst profs I've ever had. The structure is horrid. His teaching is useless. Shows you an example once which isn't in the textbook or elsewhere and then expects you to do it on the exam. Impossible to study for, also a bad marker. Save your money and avoid this prof.

This class is horrible, the structure makes no sense. Avoid this prof and class. You won't learn anything, spend your money elsewhere. He wants you to think in the box and marks like that. Any creative solutions and thinking is punished. Atrocious.

Cool prof. very humorous and extremely friendly to students. the only downside is that lecture is very boring. pay attention when he does numerical examples as those will show up on exams for sure. textbook is only for case presentation and paper purpose. lecture notes cover most of the questions on exams

Prof was nice but lecture was unbelievably boring (as was content) and doesnt usually end early. Hard to pay attention so take a laptop to pass time. Text was useless. Fair midterm but long, final was a bit harder and he throws weird questions on them.

Cool Prof, however the class was somewhat stupid. Cover cases from textbook for a paper and presentation.  But final based almost entirely on lecture notes.  There are no examples or text questions to study from.  Felt the class was somewhat useless in this aspect, as the calculation questions were based on budgets and other things from intro class

I thought Jermias was fair in all aspects. Pay attention in class and you will do fine.  Some of the comments below are simply untrue.  For the final, he noted the topics you should pay attention to and not to my surprise the topics appeared on the final.  Textbook was kind of useless though, I regretted buying/reading it. His notes are suffice.

Final is ridiculous, even when you study off the notes and examples the final questions make you feel clueless. 80% calculations on final and very hard to study from his very limited 1 example per class. Very nice teacher and gives help when asked!!
exam is super easy! i didn't read the texbook... only notes and got an A!! Oh.. i also skipped all of his classes !
Excellent
Fair marking, shows genuine interest in the subject. Constantly available for additional help. Good teacher
His final exam is super hard..and the participation is the worst..Try to find a good team....
No Comments

Avoid him at all cost. Final exam is brutal because you have no way to study for it. I read the entire book, and memorized all the lecture notes but I wasn't able to answer any of the exam questions fully. My CGPA is way above 3.5
Final exam is extremely difficult. Notes & Text book are both useless.  No way to prepare for the exam. Prof does not give any guidance. Overall, the prof is nice but grades guideline is ridiculous.
One of the worst acctg teachers I have had.  Notes are useless, exams are brutal!!!  If you can avoid him, do, because it will affect your amount of knowledge for BUS 321.

Very helpful, encourages questions. Exam: MC questions are hard; problem questions are same as examples from lectures/assignments.  Accent makes lectures a bit hard to hard to understand. But overall good prof.
funny sense of humour, but is a poor lecturer with his accent, final exams was unbelievably hard
Can't get an A+ but can probably get an A.  His funny and nice.  Definitely one that you can suck up to.
Overall a good prof.  Exams are fair.  In class participation can be fierce.
He's a very nice prof, although classroom competition can be fierce...
worst teacher ever, can't speak english stay away, needs to go back to school
Long exam, but take time to look at your 254 text before and durring exam
He is a nice prof.
Very long exam, extremely difficult to keep awake during lectures
Very helpful and his exam is fair.
